name: Kepler-326
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-326 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-326 is a star with 0.6950000000000001 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.8 times its radius. It is located 1612.19 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-326 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-326 b

Kepler-326 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 2.25 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-326.

The mass of Kepler-326 b is 2.65 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-326 b is 1.52 that of Earth. At 2.65 Earth masses, Kepler-326 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-326 c

Kepler-326 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 4.58 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-326.

The mass of Kepler-326 c is 2.16 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-326 c is 1.4 that of Earth. At 2.16 Earth masses, Kepler-326 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-326 d

Kepler-326 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 6.77 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-326.

The mass of Kepler-326 d is 1.52 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-326 d is 1.21 that of Earth. At 1.52 Earth masses, Kepler-326 d is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-326, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
